Package remixlab.dandelion.core

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Constants  
    Trackable
    Interface for objects that are to be tracked by a proscene Eye.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractScene
    A 2D or 3D interactive abstract Scene.
    Camera
    3D implementation of the Eye abstract class.
    Eye
    Abstract base class for 3D Cameras and 2D Windows.
    Frame
    A Frame is a 2D or 3D coordinate system, represented by a Frame.position(), an Frame.orientation() and Frame.magnitude().
    InteractiveAvatarFrame
    The InteractiveAvatarFrame class represents an InteractiveFrame that can be tracked by an Eye, i.e., it implements the Trackable interface.
    InteractiveEyeFrame
    The InteractiveEyeFrame class represents an InteractiveFrame with Eye specific gesture bindings.
    InteractiveFrame
    An InteractiveFrame is a Frame that can be rotated, translated and scaled by user interaction means.
    KeyFrameInterpolator
    A keyFrame Catmull-Rom Frame interpolator.
    MatrixHelper
    Various matrix operations dandelion should support either through a third-party implementation or locally through the MatrixStackHelper.
    MatrixStackHelper
    Complete implementation of MatrixHelper which attaches to it a projection matrix stack and a modelview matrix stack.
    Window
    2D implementation of the Eye abstract class.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AbstractScene.Platform  
    Camera.Type
    Enumerates the two possible types of Camera.
    Constants.ClickAction
    Click action sub-group.
    Constants.DandelionAction
    Dandelion global action enum.
    Constants.DOF1Action
    DOF1 action sub-group.
    Constants.DOF2Action
    DOF2 action sub-group.
    Constants.DOF3Action
    DOF3 action sub-group.
    Constants.DOF6Action
    DOF6 action sub-group.
    Constants.KeyboardAction
    Keyboard action sub-group.
    Constants.Target
    Which object is performing the motion action.
    Constants.WheelAction Deprecated
    Please refrain from using this type, it will be removed from future releases.
    Eye.Visibility
    Enumerates the different visibility states an object may have respect to the Eye boundary.
